hello anons have you ever considered Relay3r $RL3R? unlike most (and scam) forks this one is actually developed by a doxxed and *highly* experienced dev, and has proposed noteworthy additions to the original protocol.

the dev explains the usecase of the project here, it is a must read:
akshaycm.medium.com/relay3r-introduction-ef68c448d4df

when i say the dev is experienced dont take it lightly, check his github and see for yourself:
github.com/akshaynexus

> tokenomics:
- 15k circ supply
- market cap @ 400k

> FUD:
dev has a premine but its partially time locked and partially put in a multi-sig contract, these funds are similar if not identical to k3pr's setup, so dont bs please anon

DEXT score is 100 on all bars except for the 'information', which is being worked on (dev has submitted info to gecko and etherscan already) so should be updated soon

> links:
web: relay3r.network/
tg: t.me/relay3r
contract: 0xf771733a465441437ecf64ff410e261516c7c5f3

> why
fuck blatant 100x, shills, this could easily do idk 2 or 3x lol its somewhat more realistic
